declarations.description:
Base class for focusable components where the true focused element is inside the shadow root. This class delegates
focus to the first focusable element in the shadowroot and adds the `focusable` attribute to the component when the
component gains or loses focus. It also provides a `hasFocus` property that can be used to style the component when
it has focus.
declarations.name: CharmFocusableElement

declarations.description: An accordion is a vertically stacked set of interactive headings that each contain a title, content snippet, or thumbnail representing a section of content. The headings function as controls that enable users to reveal or hide their associated sections of content. Accordions are commonly used to reduce the need to scroll when presenting multiple sections of content on a single page.
declarations.name: CoreAccordion

declarations.description: Dialog is a window overlaid on either the primary window or another dialog window. Windows under a modal dialog are inert. That is, users cannot interact with content outside an active dialog window. Inert content outside an active dialog is typically visually obscured or dimmed so it is difficult to discern, and in some implementations, attempts to interact with the inert content cause the dialog to close.

members.name: flip
members.description: When set, placement of the popup will flip to the opposite site to keep it in view. You can use `flipFallbackPlacements` to further configure how the fallback placement is determined.

members.name: flipBoundary
members.description: The flip boundary describes clipping element(s) that overflow will be checked relative to when flipping. By default, the boundary includes overflow ancestors that will cause the element to be clipped. If needed, you can change the boundary by passing a reference to one or more elements to this property.

members.name: flipFallbackPlacements
members.description: If the preferred placement doesn't fit, popup will be tested in these fallback placements until one fits. Must be a string of any number of placements separated by a space, e.g. "top bottom left". If no placement fits, the flip fallback strategy will be used instead.

members.name: flipFallbackStrategy
members.description: When neither the preferred placement nor the fallback placements fit, this value will be used to determine whether the popup should be positioned as it was initially preferred or using the best available fit based on available space.

members.name: flipPadding
members.description: The amount of padding, in pixels, to exceed before the flip behavior will occur.

members.name: floatingUIPlacement
members.description:
Converts PopupPlacement to Floating UI Placement.
Floating UI doesn't have "start" or "end" as its first position (before the -) only "left" and "right", so convert
tooltips's start/end at the first position into left/right according to language direction.
To avoid confusion, tooltip uses "top" and "bottom" as the second position when the first is "start" or "end", so
change those to start/end for popup.

declarations.description: Radio buttons enable users to select exactly one option from a mutually exclusive set of choices. members.name: anchor
members.description: When the anchor element is separate from the popup, provide its ID or a reference to the anchor element.

members.name: announceTooltip
members.description: Announces the tooltip content to screen readers

members.name: arrow
members.description: Attaches an arrow pointing to the tooltip.

members.name: attachListeners
members.description: Adds event listeners for the anchor.

members.name: content
members.description: The content to display inside the tooltip. You can use `content` slot instead if you need text formatting.

members.name: dir
members.description: The dir global attribute is an enumerated attribute that indicates the directionality of the element's text.

members.name: disabled
members.description: Disables/enables the tooltip

members.name: distance
members.description: The distance in pixels from which to offset the tooltip away from its target.

members.name: emitRequestClose

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: The source of the close request.

members.description: Emits cancelable `{baseName}-request-close` event that hides the popup if default is not prevented.

members.name: emitScopedEvent

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the event to emit.

parameters.name: detail
parameters.description: The detail object to include with the event.

members.description: Emits event scoped to component `${this.baseName}-${name}`.

members.name: fixedPlacement
members.description: Enable this option to prevent the tooltip from being clipped when the component is placed inside a container with `overflow: auto|hidden|scroll`.

members.name: handleBlur
members.description: Handles blur event on the popup

members.name: handleClick
members.description: Handles click event on the popup

members.name: handleFocus
members.description: Handles focus event on the popup

members.name: handleKeyDown
members.description: Handles keydown event on the popup

members.name: handleMouseOut
members.description: Handles mouseout event on the popup

members.name: handleMouseOver
members.description: Handles mouseover event on the popup

members.name: handleOptionsChange
members.description: Handles popup options changing

members.name: handleSlotChange
members.description: Handles the change of the default slot which contains the anchor of the tooltip.

members.name: handleTransitionEnd
members.description: Handles the transition end

members.name: hasTrigger
members.description: Utility method to check if specified trigger is present

members.name: hide
members.description: Hides/closes the component.

members.name: onOpenChange
members.description: Handles internal logic for when the open attribute changes

members.name: open
members.description: Indicates whether or not the component is open. Can be used in lieu of show/hide methods.

members.name: placement
members.description: The preferred placement of the tooltip. Note that the actual placement may vary as needed to keep the tooltip inside of the viewport.

members.name: removeListeners
members.description: Removes event listeners for the anchor.

members.name: show
members.description: Shows/opens the component.

members.name: skidding
members.description: The distance in pixels from which to offset the tooltip along its target.

members.name: toggle
members.description: Shows or hides the component depending on whether it is currently visible.

members.name: tooltipBodyTemplate
members.description: Generates the template for the tooltip body and contents

members.name: tooltipTemplate
members.description: Generates the template for the tooltip

members.name: trigger
members.description: Controls how the tooltip is activated. Possible options include `click`, `hover`, `focus`, and `manual`. Multiple options can be passed by separating them with a space. When manual is used, the tooltip must be activated programmatically.

members.name: updateAnchorElement
members.description: Updates the trigger of the tooltip if the anchor is provided as a string.

members.name: visible
members.description: This is state is set after popup is open, used for applying transitions.

events.description: Emitted when the component has completed its initial render.

events.name: tooltip-after-hide

events.description: Emitted after the tooltip has shown and all animations are complete.
events.name: tooltip-after-show

events.description: Emitted when the tooltip begins to hide.
events.name: tooltip-hide

events.description: Emitted when the tooltip begins to show.
